value.title: ConcatenateX in Power BI and DAX   Concatenate Values of a Column
value.excerpt: It happens often in Power BI calculations and reports that you need to concatenate a list of values from a column. You can do this concatenation in Power Query or DAX. However, if the concatenation needs to be done dynamically. ConcatenateX is a very helpful DAX function to achieve such results. It is

value.title: Generate Year Month Day Combinations in Power BI Report using Power Query Date ToText Function
value.excerpt: A common requirement when reporting data with a Date axis is to be able to see the year and the month in a short form beside each other. Formats such as 2021 Jan, or Jan 2021, or even Jan 21, or 2021-01 are very popular. In Power BI, ideally, you should have a Date dimension with columns for this. However,

There are other benefits also to import Azure Active Directory (AAD) users loaded into Power BI for

value.title: Power BI Incremental Refresh and Hybrid Tables
value.excerpt: The default configuration for the Power BI dataset is to wipe out the entire data and reload it again. This can be a long process if you have a big dataset. Hybrid tables in Power BI keep part of the data in DirectQuery, and the rest is imported for data freshness and performance. In this video, I explain

value.excerpt: Have you ever wondered is it possible to have updates of the Power BI report to be emailed to you (or some other colleagues) on a daily basis? value.title: Row Filtering in Power BI and Power Query   Remove Blank Rows Vs Remove Empty
value.excerpt: When you have blank values in your data table, you can use Power Query transformations to remove the row with blank values. There are two transformations that are used very often for this purpose: Remove Empty and Remove blank rows. These two transformations are not exactly the same. In this article,

value.title: Split Column by Delimiter in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: If you have a delimiter character (or part of the text) that is repeated multiple times, and you want to extract all the text parts based on that, there is a simple way for it. In this article, I'll explain how to extract multiple parts of a text value based on a delimiter in Power BI using Power Query.

value.title: Administer Microsoft Fabric
value.excerpt: Administer Microsoft Fabric

value.title: How to build a dashboard
value.excerpt: How to build a dashboard

value.title: Create paginated reports
value.excerpt: Paginated reports allow report developers to create Power BI artifacts that have tightly controlled rendering requirements. Paginated reports are ideal for creating sales invoices, receipts, purchase orders, and tabular data. This module will teach you how to create reports, add parameters, and work with tables and charts in paginated reports.

value.title: Modify DAX filter context in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll be able to describe filter context, which is used to evaluate measure formulas. You'll then learn why some calculations need to modify filter context and that it can be achieved by using the CALCULATE function. Additionally, you'll learn how to configure the CALCULATE function with filters and filter modifiers.

value.title: Enforce Power BI model security
value.excerpt: Enforce model security in Power BI using row-level security and object-level security.

value.title: Explore Azure data services for modern analytics
value.excerpt: Understand analytics solutions in the Azure data ecosystem. Explore the architecture of a scalable analytics solution to meet business needs.
